summary: This is an email chain from July 24-25, 2019, forwarding a report from the Bureau of Prisons about Jeffrey Epstein being found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck. He was placed on suicide watch, and his cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him. The incident was under investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the email chain as U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, being informed about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck, placed on suicide watch, and his cellmate reportedly threatened to kill him.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, was overseeing the prosecution of Epstein, and was being informed of the incident in Epstein's cell.

events.title: Epstein found with noose in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, and initially placed on suicide watch, then downgraded to suicide observation.

events.title: Cellmate threat reported
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened to be killed by Epstein.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 24, 2019, at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and then downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein threatened to kill him.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the email.
The email chain shows U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman being notified of the incident.
